entry.def: A coven is a group of witches.

means.word_mean: 1. an assembly of witches; usually 13 witches

auth_sentence.content: The rest of the coven stand, some in hooded gowns, in a circle around an iron cauldron where a fire is burning.
auth_sentence.res_content: The rest of the coven stand, some in hooded gowns, in a circle around an iron cauldron where a fire is burning.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The rest of the coven stand, some in hooded gowns, in a circle around an iron cauldron where a fire is burning.

auth_sentence.content: Macbeth and Banquo, two Scottish generals in King Duncan's army, stop to visit with coven of witches.
